IRenderGraphNode

Defines an interface to a node in our render graph

Functions
GetType
virtual ERenderGraphNodeType GetType() = 0

Returns the type of this node

GetName
virtual std::string GetName() = 0

Returns the name of this node

SetName
virtual void SetName(
std::
string 
name
) = 0

Sets the name of this node

Parameters
name
std::string

name to assign to this node

SetProperty
virtual void SetProperty(
std::
string 
name,
std::
any 
value
) = 0

Assigns the named property the specified value. Properties are values that a node may use but that aren't produced by another IRenderGraphNode (think constant buffer values)

Parameters
name
std::string

Name of property

value
std::any

value to assign

GetParent

GetPinValue
virtual std::any GetPinValue(
IRenderGraphPin 
*
pPin,
IRenderer* 
pRenderer,
IRenderCtx* 
pRenderCtx
) = 0

Retrieves the value currently assigned to a pin. This value is what a node will return as its output value for the specified pin.

NOTE: Clients are not expected to call this method. It is only used during graph traversal. It will cause rendering and further traversal of the graph.

Parameters
pPin
IRenderGraphPin*

pin from which to get value

pRenderer
IRenderer*

the renderer

pRenderCtx
IRenderCtx*

current render context
